column1: Testing is one of our strongest tools in containing the spread of #COVID19. Symptoms or not knowing your status helps keep others safe. Testing is free and widely available across Connecticut. Find a location here. https://t.co/r4RtRF9lul
Thanksgiving will look different for all of us this year. Get tested. Wear a mask. Social distance. Be safe.  https://t.co/dsB8eXPYBk
THIS WEEK: No cost COVID19 testing in #Hartford Tuesday-Friday. Getting tested is one of the best ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 and protect others. https://t.co/eT4RTaZQaJ
#ICYMI: Check out my OP-ED with @RepJoeCourtney on what steps we need to take to defeat #COVID19 and unite the country. https://t.co/seD38WQlau
TODAY: Join me for a Tele-Town Hall on COVID19 at 4PM. Visit https://t.co/JvFIKZJ4IG to tune in or sign up. https://t.co/adgawtM24W

#ICYMI: I was at @HartfordHealthC yesterday to announce the bill I am introducing with @RepJoeCourtney to nationalize the production and distribution of the necessary personal protective equipment medical supplies testing and vaccines needed to defeat COVID-19. https://t.co/I5CscY0Ebc

We are at war with COVID & need to unite as a country to defeat it. I was proud to be with @HartfordHealthC to announce the bill I'm introducing with @RepJoeCourtney to nationalize the production & distribution of supplies to ensure frontline workers have the supplies they need. https://t.co/awWszYY60s
Due to rising #COVID19 infection rates CT will roll back to phase 2.1 of reopening beginning today. Learn more about what this means for you and your business here: https://t.co/uH0GzsMEps

Stay Alert! The IRS is warning of a COVID-19 text scam created by thieves to trick people into sharing their personal banking information. Remember the IRS will never text or call you asking for your banking information. Learn more here. https://t.co/MnaaVmHT7H
Health insurance coverage is always important but is especially needed during the #COVID19 pandemic. Visit https://t.co/NTSnmAMCcd now through Dec. 15th to #GetCovered https://t.co/8HEGrYFqcv
ATTENTION: 2 polling locations in #Hartford will also be offering COVID19 testing. Vote and get tested! https://t.co/wD7yW5vceD

Several #CT01 towns have been issued #COVID19 alerts. We can't let our guards down now. Continue to wear a mask practice social distancing avoid crowds and wash your hands. We can do this. https://t.co/yK0q4CZURG

#Covid19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable high-speed broadband. Today the Trump FCC doubled down on repealing #NetNeutrality making it harder for Americans to access affordable and reliable broadband. #NetNeutrality needs to be restored NOW! https://t.co/thMeSB0Uwv
ATTENTION: CT has launched a new grant program to help small businesses and nonprofits recover from the impact of #COVID-19. For more information visit the link below. https://t.co/guNBAbqtLE
Getting tested helps prevent the spread of #COVID19. Visit the link below to find #COVID19 testing centers near you. https://t.co/vUu28xUMD6

Be aware of scammers and robocalls taking advantage of #COVID19 fears to hack your personal information. Remember to never give out your Social Security number credit card information or any other sensitive personal information. Learn more here: https://t.co/Rwpa5ygd8O
#ICYMI: I joined Mike Hydeck on Face The Facts to talk about the urgent need of getting COVID relief to our communities. https://t.co/JigO6oql1k

Yesterday Dr. Deborah Birx the White House coronavirus response coordinator visited #Hartford to reminded us all how important it is to stay vigilant by social distancing and wearing masks. We must do our part to keep our families and neighbors safe. https://t.co/K76HEPSBqK

REMINDER: It's important to wear a mask *both indoors & outdoors* to prevent the spread of #COVID19. This virus is highly contagious & could affect anyone. Wearing a mask helps protect yourself & others. #MaskUpCT 😷 https://t.co/E3nE2CaKEK

ATTENTION: Tomorrow begins Connecticut’s phase 3 of reopening. Visit the link to find helpful guidance on how this affects you & your businesses. COVID is still present in our communities please continue to wear masks social distance & wash your hands! https://t.co/ZevmX0USnq

There are still 10 million fewer people employed than before #COVID19. People who are unemployed still need help. The House has now passed TWO relief packages that sit awaiting action in the Senate.  https://t.co/jULpX8NhXV

Social Security and SSI beneficiaries shouldn't be forced to repay payments they received in error from Social Security due to the COVID-19 pandemic. I'm proud that my bill with @RepDannyDavis was included in the #HeroesAct to make sure beneficiaries are protected.

.@HouseDemocrats are taking action to address #COVID with the updated #HeroesAct. This bill provides needed relief for families small businesses and the unemployed and critical support for our frontline workers. It's time for the Senate GOP to work with us and pass a bill.

Earlier this month #Hartford Public Schools were forced to delay the first day of school due to a ransomware attack. We need to do more to protect students learning virtually. I urge leadership to include funding to protect students in the next #COVID relief bill. https://t.co/OJAF79htLi
Tune into today's hearing on how we can help restaurants during the COVID pandemic: https://t.co/hJ1Yft23ic

With over 200000 lives lost to #COVID19 in America it is imperative that we have access to accurate science-based information from the @CDCgov. Their mistake this past week is unacceptable and cannot happen again. https://t.co/0EQQ6os5n0

We’ve now lost over 200000 precious lives to #COVID19 in America. As we mourn the lives lost to this virus we need action to prevent further devastation. @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct in May to keep Americans safe. The @SenateGOP must act NOW! https://t.co/SrNb2QNPGG
Face masks are our best defense against COVID-19. https://t.co/f67pnKNmmh
President Trump mislead the American people by purposely downplaying the dangers of the Coronavirus. #TrumpKnew and it cost our country hundreds of thousands of lives. https://t.co/WIwlGvGmgs

March 19: 12600+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 265 confirmed COVID deaths in U.S. Today: 6334150+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 189970+ confirmed COVID deaths in U.S. #TrumpKnew and the numbers speak for themselves. https://t.co/BOpTopWE4H

This morning I spoke with members of the Community Health Center Association of Connecticut. Our community health centers are on the frontline of this war against #COVID19 and are vital to keeping our communities safe during this crisis. https://t.co/TgYgqz0BQF

The coronavirus crisis is hitting state & local governments hard – forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. The #HeroesAct provides nearly $1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. #FamiliesFirst

The start of the school year will look very different for students and their families due to #COVID19. CT families with questions on getting back to school this year can find resources for remote learning state guidelines and more by visiting https://t.co/S08knH3LgC

Over 6 million Americans have been diagnosed with #COVID19 and over 180000 have died. Rent is due today and millions are still unemployed. How much longer must America wait for the Senate to pass the #HeroesAct?

CT residents struggling to pay rent or mortgage as a result of hardship caused by #COVID19 may qualify for temporary housing assistance. For more information visit https://t.co/XPkGg4pwpk or call  1-860-785-3111

For 85 yrs #SocialSecurity has meant economic security for millions of Americans. Now Trump is trying to defund it after his administration failed to contain COVID19. We must stop these attacks & protect this program with #HR7499 which would expand benefits during the pandemic!

The @USPS is a critical service to Americans especially during COVID-19.  The Trump Administration's recent @USPS restructuring threatens to disenfranchise American votes. Yesterday I joined @speakerpelosi & @RepMaloney to ensure accountability & uninterrupted postal service. https://t.co/xHVMC60kUW

I joined my colleagues in urging the inclusion of immigrant families in the next COVID19 relief bill. Immigrant communities have been working on the frontlines to help our nation get through this crisis. They deserve this critical support. https://t.co/Gai9fgfNsW
I'm working with my colleagues to make sure 5 million Americans don't face a cut in their #SocialSecurity benefits due to the COVID-19 induced recession. More here: https://t.co/AAo9vAc6LP

We need to ensure people turning 60 this year do not lose some of their #SocialSecurity benefits because of the #COVID19 pandemic. My bill #HR7499 would fix this issue and would expand these hard-earned benefits to help those most in need right now https://t.co/V6Wq3WBWkF

Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers warned that the economy is in grave danger without another #COVID19 stimulus package. Enhancing #SocialSecurity benefits puts money right back into the economy - my bill #HR7499 would do just that! https://t.co/rPBJSvD12X

Millions of parents were struggling to find affordable child care even before the #COVID19 pandemic. That’s why @HouseDemocrats are advancing two bills to provide relief for families & providers. I am proud to have voted for this badly needed immediate relief. https://t.co/HdtACMasRP

The #TRUSTact could fast track harmful cuts to #SocialSecurity and #Medicare. This legislation has no business being included in the next #COVID19 package. We need to #ExpandSocialSecurity instead to protect our nation's most vulnerable. https://t.co/DKPaXuerZ7

Under the proposed GOP #COVID19 package CT residents would see a 43% cut in Unemployment Insurance benefits. We can't allow Americans to be evicted & unable to pay bills because of the pandemic. The Senate must do what's best for families and pass the #HeroesAct

Families need childcare. Schools need plans and resources. Furloughed workers need assistance. State and local governments need funding. The Trump Administration does not need a new FBI building in the next #COVID19 package. https://t.co/2BI652FrSi

CT’s #COVID19 rapid testing site located @CVSHealth in #Hartford will now remain open through September. This is good news for Hartford and the State as we work to contain the virus. https://t.co/h3QCcOQ6Tm

Senate Republicans are trying to add a bill to the next COVID relief bill which would make it easier to fast track cuts to #SocialSecurity. Cuts are not what's needed during times like these! We need to strengthen Social Security with my relief bill. https://t.co/XSmrqrckjt
Due to COVID more than 4 million Americans are facing a significant cut in their #SocialSecurity benefits. That’s why I introduced a bill to protect and expand benefits. https://t.co/6Mt1YKQ988

More than 2 months ago Fed Chairman Jerome Powell urgently called on Congress to provide additional #COVID19 relief to Americans. The House responded by passing the #HeroesAct. The time for the @SenateGOP to act is now! https://t.co/yeD352MBIE
More information on the  Social Security COVID-19 Correction and Equity Act can be found using the link below. https://t.co/uZNdhCkiib

.@IntercommunityH plays an integral role in providing many health services to East Hartford & Hartford residents. I'm proud they will receive $191492 from HHS to expand #COVID19 testing so they can continue to serve our community & keep our neighbors safe.https://t.co/SAEzR4jjuJ

Black and Latinx people have been 3x as likely to become infected & 2x as likely to die from COVID19 as their white neighbors according to data @nytimes obtained from the CDC. This is another example of the systemic racism in our country that must change. https://t.co/wLCw0XnJv7
ICYMI: I introduced a bill today to prevent #SocialSecurity cuts due to the COVID economic crisis and expand benefits to those most in need: https://t.co/uZNdhCkiib

With more than 124000 COVID-19-related deaths and unemployment numbers not seen since the Great Depression the American people overwhelmingly support the strong urgent relief included in the HEROES Act. @SenateMajLdr must pass the #HeroesAct NOW!

ATTENTION: If you don't file taxes and have yet to receive your Economic Impact Payment authorized by Congress to help you during the COVID19 crisis you can use the @IRSnews Non-Filer Tool to check if you’re eligible for an Economic Impact Payment: https://t.co/bW8nPutGSV

Connecticut residents have done a great job adhering to public health guidelines to combat #COVID19. This has led to one of the lowest infection rates in the country. But we can’t let our guard down. Continue to wear masks and keep 6 feet apart! https://t.co/FkqhomHLNS

Systemic racism is deeply rooted in the US. We see it in the rates of COVID-19 deaths mass incarceration & in the excessive use of force too many people of color face. The nation is calling for change in how policing is done. #JusticeInPolicingAct delivers meaningful reforms. https://t.co/lBFaiarrc3

ATTENTION: The SBA has reopened their application portal for Economic Injury Disaster Loans (EIDL) to all eligible businesses and non-profits impacted by #COVID19. You can apply using the link below.  https://t.co/xuz4T3dP3v

#COVID19 has intensified longstanding racial disparities. Deaths due to COVID are far higher among Black Latinx and Native Americans. I joined my colleagues on a bipartisan letter requesting that any future COVID stimulus package prioritize programs in underserved communities. https://t.co/KYHtwUdRGL

Our nation isn't just battling the COVID-19 pandemic. We're also fighting 400+ years of systemic racism and a gun violence epidemic. History shows us these challenges have existed in our country for too long. We need to meet this moment with action. https://t.co/ihzPn93jSd

.@CVSHealth has opened their second rapid testing site in CT. Call Hartford 311 or (860) 757-9311 to make an appointment and get a free 30 minute #COVID19 test. No symptoms referral or insurance necessary https://t.co/0AnVhtMEXp

TODAY: at 12:30 PM join me for a virtual town hall with  @SBAGov CT District Director Mark Hayward. We will be discussing the latest on #COVID19 relief for small businesses. You can watch this virtual event using the link below. https://t.co/erlncSqiq0

Testing is vital in keeping our communities safe from #COVID19- especially in Black and Latinx communities where this virus has hit the hardest. Thank you @HartfordHealthC and all of our partners for making this free easy and convenient testing site possible. https://t.co/9uxRcBGi17

TOMORROW: at 12:30 PM join me for a virtual town hall with @SBAGov CT District Director Mark Hayward. We will be discussing the latest on #COVID19 relief for small businesses. You can watch this virtual event using the link below. https://t.co/erlncSqiq0

ATTENTION: Join me on Tuesday June 2nd at 12:30 PM for a virtual town hall with @SBAgov CT District Director Mark Hayward. We will be discussing the latest on #COVID19 relief for small businesses. You can watch this virtual event using the link below. https://t.co/erlncSqiq0

We have now lost 100000 Americans to #COVID19 - a heartbreaking number. These aren’t just numbers they are our family members friends and coworkers. My prayers and thoughts are with their loved ones. https://t.co/S6d1hjwL0X
#COVID19 has shed light on the existing structural inequities that have led to health disparities for Black & Latinx Americans. https://t.co/EQoUbXiaRO
#ICYMI: I joined @MikeHydeck on Face the Facts to talk about the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts and next steps moving forward. https://t.co/yyA6pR5cHC

The #COVID19 pandemic has had a disproportionate impact on communities of color in Connecticut and across the nation. Tomorrow’s @WaysMeansCmte hearing will focus on how we can address these disparities. WATCH: https://t.co/JGJbf37aOj

Older Americans are among our most vulnerable to the consequences of #COVID19. As we recognize #OlderAmericansMonth we must do more to protect them including their economic health.  We can help by strengthening and expanding Social Security! #Secure2100 https://t.co/wXd7YbW1Qp
TOMORROW: Free #COVID19 testing at Batchelder school in #Hartford. No insurance or referral necessary. You can book your appointment by calling 860-904-9045 today. https://t.co/ZZunoTiMTA

I voted for the #HeroesAct because we must address this health crisis in order to move forward. Our #EssentialWorkers need help and we must do everything we can to slow the spread of COVID-19 through testing and contact tracing. https://t.co/eEtOBPbi89
It was great talking with @mikehydeck about the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts. Make sure to tune into @nbcconnecticut on Sunday at 10AM. https://t.co/1C46l9lMGL
Join me tonight starting at 7pm for a virtual town hall with leaders from all across Connecticut to discuss the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts. #CTTownHall https://t.co/sRORU30Svr

America is in the midst of a crisis unmatched by any other in our lifetime as a result of #COVID19. It's up to the federal government to step up and help our country overcome this pandemic. Here are my thoughts on what we must do next: https://t.co/0Nb9HbLqXC

REMINDER: There are now 5 #COVID19 testing sites with another 3 planned in Hartford. You do NOT need a referral prescription health insurance or to be displaying symptoms to receive a test. https://t.co/d0OXpzEBAG

TOMORROW: @CVSHealth will be launching new #COVID19 testing sites in Hartford Glastonbury Rocky Hill and South Windsor. Schedule your appointment using the link below https://t.co/Ie3ybnScZr https://t.co/huHAciM9Bq

As Americans deal with the realities of #COVID19 access to quality and affordable health care could not be more important. That's why I'm supporting @RepSusanWild's bipartisan bill to make sure we cover our kids through this crisis. https://t.co/CMmolNyqm5
ATTENTION: Phillips Health Center in Hartford will be providing free mobile COVID19 testing until 4PM Today. To register call 860-904-9045. https://t.co/uuBFRLMUPM
Wearing a face mask helps slow the spread of COVID-19. Check out these tips from @CDCgov on proper ways to wear a face mask and how you can make one at home. https://t.co/82hqwFspeJ

Our @CTNationalGuard soldiers are vital to protecting CT residents and supporting the effort to slow the spread of #COVID19. I joined the CT delegation in urging the Trump Administration to extend federal authorization and funding for our National Guard. https://t.co/mmruL7Xgux

It was great joining @CTWBDC @SBAGov & @MdsxChamber for a virtual town hall via Zoom to talk with small business owners impacted by COVID-19. Small businesses have been hit incredibly hard by this pandemic and I will continue to fight for the relief they need. https://t.co/PaBBEBT0Bu
We need to #ExpandSocialSecurity and put money in the hands of those who need it most during #COVID19 : seniors communities of color and people with disabilities - not corporations.
#COVID19 puts our families at risk especially seniors. The Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act will #ExpandSocialSecurity and protect our seniors.

We should be strengthening #SocialSecurity not giving a payroll tax cut to corporations and the wealthy. That's why I introduced the Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act to help our most vulnerable during the #COVID19 pandemic. #ExpandSocialSecurity

Fontline workers struggling to find or pay for childcare during #COVID19 can now apply for assistance provided through #CTCares. This program offers direct payments to child care providers so frontline workers can continue to work. Learn more here: https://t.co/PTBM83aLi8
Scammers have been using the coronavirus pandemic to take advantage of people. Do not fall victim to an IRS scam. You can learn more at https://t.co/1c3sZCtJO7

#COVID19 has taken a severe toll on nursing homes across the country including here in Connecticut. Yesterday I joined my colleagues in urging @HHSGov allocate funds to increase COVID19 testing to contain and prevent the spread of this virus in these facilities. https://t.co/E3DrTuJzmo

#COVID19 has exposed the longstanding health disparities in communities of color. As we move forward we must ensure our most vulnerable communities have access to #COVID19 testing they need. https://t.co/F03r7mszpf

The #COVID19 pandemic has brought economic hardship to all types of workers and families. We can't leave anyone out of relief efforts. That’s why I’m supporting @RepDanKildee’s bill to make UI work for everyone including students and part time workers. #StrongUI

As so many lives have been disrupted by this pandemic our charitable non profits have served as the backbone of our communities. I joined my colleagues in urging full support to these organizations as they continue providing frontline services in response to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/btqRMhiID1

UNEMPLOYMENT UPDATE: @CTDOL has announced instructions on how self-employed individuals including independent contractors and “gig workers” can apply for UI. These benefits will be retroactive to Covid-19 related loss of income.  https://t.co/Va57X5qVfp

Nursing homes are among the hardest hit by the #COVID19 epidemic which is why I am urging @CMSGov to protect residents in these facilities. We must do more to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/UDnDd6GHf9

Our #Frontline medical workers are our soldiers in the war against this virus and we must give them the protections they deserve. I joined my colleagues in calling on future #COVID19 relief packages to include provisions to protect #Frontline medical workers. https://t.co/CEn9kt5Ui4
I joined @sbransfield1 & Portland town officials on the Town of Portland podcast for the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts. Check it out here: https://t.co/fkfyWE7W1C

The #COVID19 epidemic has created hardship for many families and individuals if you’re struggling with food insecurity you may be eligible for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). For more on resources related to food assistance visit: https://t.co/DHwQruDOl0

America is experiencing the highest numbers of unemployment since the Great Depression. The CARES Act expanded assistance to help workers during this unprecedented time. You can find more information about Unemployment Insurance during #COVID19 here https://t.co/V5EN9nfMcL

The Families First Act guarantees employees ten days of sick leave at 100% wage replacement if they are quarantining under the advice of a healthcare provider government order or seeking a medical diagnosis related to #COVID19 More info here: https://t.co/jxa7Qc85RZ

The impact of #COVID19 has left uncertainty with stable housing. If you are currently residing in public or assisted housing under the CARES Act you are protected from eviction for four months if you cannot pay your rent. More information here: https://t.co/vtalQLGL2S

The #COVID19 crisis sheds light on the existing racial disparities in health outcomes for our communities of color.  I applaud @MayorBronin & public health officials in taking steps to address this issue. https://t.co/igHMhIyVcC

Testing testing testing- is vital to protecting our front-line workers and mitigating the spread of #COVID19. Thank you to all of our community health centers and hospitals on the ground stepping up to increase testing in our communities. https://t.co/1qxS3wA4TK

Our nation’s health and economic recovery are inextricably linked during this pandemic. Today's #CoronavirusRelief package strengthens the Paycheck Protection Program and brings vital funding to hospitals healthcare workers & testing but more must be done! https://t.co/HY0Z4Qc5g2

Our food banks are on the frontlines serving families in need amid the #COVID19 crisis. Thank you to @Foodshare and all of our food banks across the state and country who have increased their distribution to meet demand. https://t.co/og65JPQPuR

As our state’s front-line workers and public health officials respond to this crisis on the ground we need a strong federal testing strategy to lead the effort to ramp up necessary testing for COVID19.

Today I joined @RepBobbyRush in calling on @EPA to secure equal rights to clean air protections. Air pollution has not only contributed to the climate crisis but is linked to the lethality of COVID-19 in our most vulnerable communities.   We need action now. #EarthDay https://t.co/bKutj7fW8b

It was great talking with @johndankosky on the @CTMirror podcast “Steady Habits” about my role on the Congressional task force to reopen America and the latest #COVID19 relief package from Congress. Check it out: https://t.co/uxsHpiR8Kc

This initiative between @HartfordHealthC and @QuestDX to significantly increase Connecticut’s #COVID19 testing capacity is critical to containing the spread of #COVID19 and protecting frontline workers. https://t.co/AtaMMx5QBF

The special alert issued by the IRS could impact the ability of Social Security beneficiaries to care for their dependent children or grandchildren. These Americans are among the hardest hit by the #COVID19 pandemic and deserve their relief without delay! https://t.co/WPPzNb5m2u

#ICYMI: I joined @JennBNews on @FOX61’s The Real Story to talk about the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts the importance of testing and my role on the Congressional task force to reopen the country. https://t.co/SYR57qm8yk

This #NationalVolunteerWeek I thank all of our volunteers who have helped our communities respond to the #COVID19 crisis by organizing food banks sewing masks giving blood and so much more. https://t.co/zrCJypI8iz

The CARES Act provides unemployment insurance to individuals who have become unemployed due to #COVID19. Emergency benefit increases of $600 per week to individuals will begin to be paid out on 4/27 & payments will be retro to the 1st week in which the claimant filed for benefits
#ICYMI: I joined @NutmegTV to talk about the next steps needed to address the ongoing #COVID19 epidemic. https://t.co/Pyf5WPFPgh
#ICYMI: I joined @MikeHydeck on @NBCConnecitcut’s Face the Facts to talk about the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts. https://t.co/by3oanvq1l

English-language proficiency should not be a barrier to obtaining vital public health guidance during a pandemic. I joined my colleagues in urging the Trump Administration in producing and making available #COVID19 related resources in Spanish and other languages. https://t.co/fwDh8exOMs

This week I join my colleagues in recognizing #BlackMaternalHealthWeek. We must address the crisis black women face in unacceptably high maternal mortality rates. It is imperative we fix this crisis for the invaluable moms in our communities especially as we combat #COVID19

@Bradley_Airport and the airports around the state play an important role in keeping our communities & economy connected. This week our state’s airports will receive $30 million in critical support through #CARESAct to mitigate the unprecedented impact of the #COVID19 pandemic.

As public health experts and most notably Dr. Fauci have stated the COVID-19 pandemic is first and foremost a health crisis which has devastated the economy.  We must work to address both issues head on and at the same time. This is an enormous challenge.
Our seniors are among the most vulnerable to #COVID19. We must do more to protect the health and economic security of our seniors in the next relief package! https://t.co/neqnGn8C01
Have questions about the #COVID19 Relief Direct Payments? Visit our FAQ at https://t.co/l7EuQIpNpE
FYI: The State of Connecticut has an emergency alert system. To receive notifications from CTAlert text keyword COVIDCT to 888-777.

Our small businesses are the backbone of our economy and we must continue to support them in the face of this pandemic. As we look to the next steps of #COVID19 relief packages by Congress supporting our small businesses must remain a top priority. https://t.co/bfT1plJMBk

Through the #CARES Act community health centers in the 1st District will be receiving $5.6 million in funding to combat the #COVID19 epidemic. These health centers treat and protect our most vulnerable neighbors and we must do more to support them. https://t.co/UJVzjr1aDe

Structural racism has impacted African Americans and Latinos in many ways for years and now we are seeing it manifest in #COVID19. We must work hard to stop the spread of coronavirus and protect vulnerable members of our community. https://t.co/CzgxhFwlcu

So many companies and individuals in Connecticut and across the nation have stepped up to help us tackle this epidemic together. For more information on how you can help in supporting #COVID19 relief visit: https://t.co/TbKQCpCzHe
It was great talking with @MikeHydeck via Skype about the latest on #COVID19 relief efforts. Make sure to tune into @NBCConnecticut on Sunday at 10AM! https://t.co/NAAgRN46gD

Families are struggling because of #COVID19. We should be offering more resources not taking them away. That's why I joined the CT delegation in sending a letter to the USDA urging the dept. to stop their plan to kick thousands of Connecticut residents off SNAP. https://t.co/G7Pcj4fe8V

Each year on April 7th we recognize our doctors nurses and other health workers for their contributions to our world. On this year's #WorldHealthDay we must thank those workers on the front lines of #Covid19. Thank you today and every day for keeping our communities safe.
If you have become unemployed due to #COVID19 you can file for unemployment benefits at https://t.co/ns49baShLB.  For more information visit here https://t.co/V5EN9nfMcL https://t.co/U5SSlkktsF

Under the CARES Act which Congress passed last week small businesses impacted by COVID-19 are eligible for an emergency advance of up to $10000 to help pay for payroll sick leave business obligations and more. Find more information here https://t.co/JA42WrD0ZB

If you are concerned about making your rent or mortgage payments due to COVID-19 the CARES Act passed by Congress last week may provide protections and assistance. Find more information here https://t.co/vtalQLYmrs

Today is the 1st of the month which  means many CT residents affected by #COVID19 may be wondering how they will make this month’s mortgage payment. @govnedlamont has announced that many of CT’s Credit Unions/banks have stepped up to provide relief https://t.co/6GE2lhtHme

Today I led a letter urging the IRS to provide automatic #COVID-19 Relief Payments to Social Security and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) beneficiaries. We need to make relief easier to access not harder. https://t.co/4pmruniXAM

During this critical time we must ensure families have the support they need. I joined @RepAngieCraig on the All Dependent Children Count Act to expand access to COVID-19 recovery rebates for children younger than 19 students 24 & younger & dependents who are disabled. https://t.co/VprcNgBkqK
Today I voted for the #CARESAct to provide much needed relief in response to the #COVID19 pandemic. Thank you to all our health care heroes who are on the front lines! https://t.co/oY03dkLkRc

While today's #COVID19 relief package isn’t perfect it includes vital health care funding to help our professionals on the frontlines it direct payments to Americans to help them weather this storm and it enhances Unemployment Insurance. Full comments: https://t.co/y8R5fukCHY

The #COVID19 has changed all our lives. Congress needs to act & it needs to act now. Most urgently we need to treat this as a health crisis & infuse our health care system w/ resources to treat patients increase testing protect health care workers & develop treatments/vaccine

As CT continues to combat the growing #COVID19 epidemic it’s critical we mobilize every resource in our state.
